events.name: DataScience SG Meetup - April (Nielsen)
events.description: UPDATE: Five more days to our meetup and 101 people on the waitlist. For those who've successfully RSVPed but now realise you're unable to attend, may we request for you to change your RSVP to 'No' please? Thank you! For our meetup in April we'll have speakers from Nielsen share about their recent data science endeavours. 7.15 pm: Networking (Finger food sponsored by our generous speakers =) 7.30 pm: • Speakers: Dr. Tung Whye Loon, Lim Chong Jie, Timothy Banks (Nielsen Data Science Institute/Buy Methods) • Title: Location-based Analytics for Marketing Research • Abstract: Nielsen is a leading marketing research company, over 90 years old, employing some 35,000 staff, and present around the world. This talk will cover work by the Nielsen Innovation Lab in Singapore. First we look into how satellite imagery can be used to improve sampling through the use of machine learning techniques, and then how the same techniques were applied to automate work allocations for field interviews on a major project. In closing, we’ll look at exploratory work in how location could be used to enhance the quality of outlet records and measure exposure to outdoor advertising. 8.45 pm: Closing and networking. See you there! =D
events.location: SMU School of Business, Seminar Room 2-2, 50 Stamford Road, Singapore 178899

events.name: Front End TL;DR April 2015
events.description: We are being hosted by Smartkarma, a young startup disrupting the financial industry. They are located in Changi Business Park (Expo MRT) because that's where most financial institutions have their IT operations. FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
